snippet: After an initial flush of enthusiasm, merchants have grown wary of daily deal Web sites like Groupon and LivingSocial. Now consumers are starting to follow.
abstract: Merchants have begun to grow wary of daily deal Web sites like Groupon and LivingSocial, reversing an initial flush of enthusiasm, as consumers exhibit 'deal fatigue'; 798 daily deal sites shut their doors in the last six months of 2011, and shares of Groupon have fallen 82 percent since it went public in November.

byline.original: By STEPHANIE CLIFFORD and CLAIRE CAIN MILLER

lead_paragraph: After an initial flush of enthusiasm, merchants have grown wary of daily deal Web sites like Groupon and LivingSocial. Now consumers are starting to follow.

headline.seo: Merchants and Shoppers Sour on Daily Deal Sites Like Groupon
headline.main: Merchants and Shoppers Sour on Daily Deal Sites
